text.text_translated: Many large supermarkets have been criticised for various bad actions over the last ten years. They have wasted a lot of food, they have underpaid their suppliers, and they have used too much plastic packaging, which has had an impact on our environment. But supermarkets and food shops are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash (a strong negative reaction) against the huge amount of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have committed to changing their packaging and reducing plastic waste.
